How to Install keepnote on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • keepnote

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install keepnote on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing keepnote on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall keepnote in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install keepnote, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install keepnote Using apt

To install keepnote in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install keepnote using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install keepnote

The installation of keepnote might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install keepnote Using apt-get

To install keepnote using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install keepnote.

sudo apt-get -y install keepnote

Install keepnote Using Synaptic

To install keepnote using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install keepnote on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for keepnote. This will display the keepnote package in the package window, now to install keepnote, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the keepnote package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of keepnote.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install keepnote Using aptitude

To install keepnote on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of keepnote.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install keepnote using the command aptitude install keepnote.

sudo aptitude -y install keepnote

How to Upgrade keepnote on debian

If you want to upgrade the keepnote package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade keepnote using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade keepnote to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade keepnote.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade keepnote sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade keepnote

Upgrade keepnote using Aptitude

To upgrade keepnote using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade keepnote.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade keepnote

Upgrade keepnote using Synaptic

To upgrade keepnote using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for keepnote, now right-click keepnote, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade keepnote just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall keepnote on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall keepnote from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just keepnote, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove keepnote

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of keepnote

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of keepnote you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge keepnote

Remove keepnote using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall keepnote using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for keepnote, right-click the keepnote package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall keepnote click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install keepnote on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade keepnote using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of keepnote then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
